main_definition: The word 'sic' is an adverb used to indicate that a quoted statement, especially one containing errors or idiosyncrasies, was transcribed exactly as it appeared in the original source.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A word originating from Latin and used in English to denote that a quoted passage contains an error or unusual feature as part of the original material.
meanings_and_examples.example: 'He said, 'I am fine,' even though he clearly wasn't. I marked it with sic.'
